trends: There have been 21 other sightings in Katy
There were no other sightings in Katy on or around November 2nd 2008
divs: sighting detailsconditions: moon phase 1\4 illuminated (bright) in west at about 30 deg off horizon, weather clear, sky unobstructed. ambient light from my back porch. i had just returned home and let my dogs out in my backyard to go pee. i was standing in my backyard, looking up at the sky, and i saw almost directly overhead a formation of lights whose brightness and appearance were almost identical to starlight. given the conditions and my location, most bright stars were visible but smaller ones were not. there were about 3-4 lights, in a triangle formation. they moved from northeast to southwest (from my location, first sighted about due north at 75deg and last sighted as they got lost in the ambient moonlight at about due west at 20 deg). at first i thought it was an aircraft, but the lights did not flash and were uncharacteristic of aircraft lights. the speed was also uncharacteristic of an aircraft - the speed was much faster as it took about 6 seconds to traverse an arc across the sky (from my viewpoint) of about 45 deg. there were also two obvious aircraft approaching from due west inbound with landing lights illuminated most likely headed for iah or hou. i also thought perhaps it was a satellite, except that there were multiple objects. lastly, i thought perhaps it could be a meteor shower, except that the speed seemed far too slow and there were no tails or streaks. based on the illumination, apparent speed, and nature of the event i believe strongly that this was an object in space rather than an aircraft in earth atmosphere. my best guess at this point is a collection of space debris in low earth orbit. note: a man called a local radio show today and reported a set of triangular lights "over highway 249" at 3am on this same night.
